tweet: The IRS and Treasury Dept. have released new instructions, urging people to use the "Get My Payment" tool by noon on Wednesday, May 13th, to accelerate the delivery of their Economic Impact Payment. You can read their press release here: https://t.co/TRojsmWgkT

The USPS plays a critical role in our fight against the #coronavirus pandemic, delivering personal protective equipment (PPE) and vital supplies to hospitals, food banks, essential businesses, along with key deliveries to the American people.  #SaveTheUSPS

1/3 As people across the country shelter at home to help stop the spread of the #coronavirus, Americans are now forced to rely solely on the internet to access public benefits, search for employment, learn from home or access telehealth services.

1/2 The EIDL program was created to provide up to $10,000 of emergency funding to small businesses & private non-profits impacted by COVID-19.  This was designed to serve as an immediate cash payment to keep strained businesses open while they wait for their EIDL to be processed.

In times of crisis, true heroes rise to help those in need.  Happy #NationalNursesDay to all of the dedicated nurses protecting our communities. We must honor our healthcare workers by making sure they have the resources they need to save lives while protecting their own safety.

FEMA and HHS should provide COVID-19 testing for places like Brockton, Quincy, Boston and Norwood in my district BEFORE they provide enhanced testing to Congress on Capitol Hill. Our health care workers and first responders are on the front lines.
